text: Amazing sushi. Service is on the slow side, but by far the best choice for take out on the south shore. Really decent prices.

This place is my absolute favourite sushi restaurant. The chef's choice is always creative, fresh, varied, and so delicious. The only issue I've had was with the timing of my take-out order, but I'd be willing to wait a long time for this sushi! Service is courteous and professional.
Très belle présentation,  ambiance longe,  beaux personnel,  et bon sushi.  Probablement un des meilleurs sur la rive-sud.

Meilleur sushi sur la rive sud. Il faut par contre réserver car très achalandé. Apporter votre vin en plus. Le staff est très sympathique et serviable.  Le chef propriétaire a un talent fou . J'adore le concept du 6 services. Vraiment excellent

Truly the best sushis you'll get on the south shore. From the simple cuts of sashimi, to some of the most complexes makis I've had. This place is never a let down.If you ever wanna treat yourself ask for the chefs choice and say it's your first time that way you get the full experience . Owner and staff super friendly.Bonus :BYOB

Belle ambiance apaisante, et la fraicheur des ingredients est parfaite. Nous avons beaucoup aime notre experience. Beaucoup de variete dans le menu propose. Nous y sommes aller en attendant un autre evenement et ce fut une tres agreable surprise!
Really good. Great service. Bring your own wine! Excellent! On top of my list for sushis!

Excellent petit coin du Japon en plein décor de béton (brossard beach)  Uni Sushi m'a impressionnée ! Le menu du mini est très raisonnable dans les prix et le sushi est d'une qualité exceptionnelle. Je recommande !! Plein de rouleaux spéciaux (maison) et autres classiques mieux connus comme le California roll ou le Vancouver Roll.

Uni is as good as if not better than any other sushi restaurant that I've eaten at in Montreal. The restaurant was introduced to me by friends from Vancouver. I knew that  f it was up to Vancouver standards than it was going to be good.   I was not disappointed. Everything that we ordered at Uni was excellent and reasonably priced. The restaurant is pretty small and very popular so reservations are a must.   Enjoy!

Service excellent et ethousiasmé.  Ces gens semblent passionnés. Bravo   Nous avons pris le spéciaal 5 services et chacun avaient plusieurs saveurs distinctes.  Pour l'umami c'est l'endroit paefait.  On y retouenera Cuisine sushi/fusion  Notez que pour moi c'est pas une place à sushi.  C'est vraiment FUSION de style asiatique a base sushi.  Très bon.

This is a very small restaurant with take out. It's a BYOB, the menu has all the good sushi you can handle they also have a course selection. This was recommended by the waiter and I gave it a try. I'm glad I did 5 course and all were wonderful. I would definitely recommend this place. It just missed 5 stars because the take out area has no waiting area making if very crowded with people standing by the cash register.

Based on the outward appearance of this place, you would think it's rubbish. And you'd be wrong. Uni sushi serves some of the freshest, tastiest sushi on the south shore. It's excellent. I was extremely impressed.  Keep in mind that it's not Japanese owned, so it's not a classical sushi place that specialises in sashimi, Uni tends to do fusiony things like rolls, and they do them very well.  I've only eaten there once because it isn't exactly in my neighborhood, but I absolutely recommend it.

McSushi. I think I gained 5 lbs. Way too heavy on the mayo and sauces and special rolls... sushi should be fresh and light! I would have liked to taste some more traditional sushi somewhere in there. Also, the service gets really slow when the restaurant is full. I should not have to flag down the staff three or four times in one meal!
Bonne place de sushi sur la rive-sud Apportez votre vin. Beacoup de sortes et abordable. Je le recommande
Excellent ! Bouffe et service. Meilleur place Sushi ! Qualité exceptionnelle, mélange des goûts sont un extase pour le palais. Bravo.

Sushi incroyable, bel endroit, un peu petit mais ça fait son charme ! Les sushis sont extrêmement frais et gouteux ! On doit réserver les jours occupés (vendredi et fin de semaine) parce que la salle est toujours pleine. On peut apporter notre vin ce qui est toujours un plus ! Clairement la meilleure place pour des sushis de la rive-sud de Montréal ! Je vous recommande le sushi "ginger", qui est excellent !

I heard about this place a few years ago and I always hear great reviews about the food. Here is the truth, it is not real Japanese cuisine but a fusion of Japanese and Peruvian.  the reason they explained to my boyfriend and I is each region of the city has a perferance.   We ordered the 62$ for two persons dishes which consist of sushis, salads and raw fishes. I notice they put a lot of vinegar in some of the dishes. Overall, our menu consist of a little bit of everything on the menu and it tastes great. I had a lovely experience and my boyfriend who is even more picky than i love the experience. the decorations compliment our dishes as well.   I love how the waiters jokes and talked to you.... especially the Vietnamese one (sorry, I didnt catch your name). I want to say thanks for making the evening extra special for my boyfriend and I.  I will go back again.
Don't be fooled by its exterior.  Once inside, you forget that you are in some ugly strip mall. The ambiance, food, and service was great.

Qualité - prix, imbattable! Tous les morceaux de poissons sont frais. Leur variété de sushis est surprenantes et délicieux. Petit restaurant. Un peu entassé mais on ne réalise plus lorsqu'on commence à jaser avec notre compagnie. Ils font des takeout. Le service peut être long par moment surtout les weekends Où il y a bcp de takeout et de monde sans le restaurant. Vaut toutefois la peine. Faite une réservation pour être sûr d'avoir une table.
